posts.post_content:
He's a perfect one-drop, but that's what worries me; image drawing a 0/1 on turn five. Ouch. I realize Simic can easily build him up with all the 1+/+1 counter engines it has, but Evolve looks like a double-edged sword to me.  
  
Still better than poor Cipher though.

Posted By: Superllama12 (5/20/2013 10:24:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The reason this isn't comparable to [Delver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver) is that the two cards go in completely different decks. This becomes like Delver once you cast two creatures (one with 2+ power or 3+ toughness) which most decks running delver will practically never do. It does fulfill a similar role in different control styles though (note that [Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas) and other control creatures can easily pump up this bird while helping you keep control), so it's worth considering for the sort of role Delver performs in decks more focused on instants/sorceries.
posts.html:
The reason this isn't comparable to Delver is that the two cards go in completely different decks. This becomes like Delver once you cast two creatures (one with 2+ power or 3+ toughness) which most decks running delver will practically never do. It does fulfill a similar role in different control styles though (note that Augur of Bolas and other control creatures can easily pump up this bird while helping you keep control), so it's worth considering for the sort of role Delver performs in decks more focused on instants/sorceries.

posts.post_content: Everyone knows this is typically your best one-drop in Simic, but what a lot of people apparently miss about him is that even late-game he's at least viable if you're utilizing [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer) correctly. Even if your Biomancer has no counters on him, this thing is still a 2/3 flyer for U, which is not strictly worse than [Insectile Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Insectile Aberration).
